./external/basejump_stl/bsg_misc/bsg_round_robin_arb.v Cov: 27.9% 

   1: // Round robin arbitration unit
   2: 
   3: // Automatically generated using bsg_round_robin_arb.py
   4: // DO NOT MODIFY
   5: 
   6: // this arbiter has a few usage scenarios which explains the somewhat complicated interface.
   7: // Informal description of the interface:
   8: // grants_en_i  - Whether to suppress grant_o signals and tag_o, which are computed based on reqs_i
   9: // sel_one_hot_o- The selection signal after the arbitration.
  10: // grant_o      - The grant signals that taking grant_en_i into consideration.
  11: // v_o          - Whether any reqs_i signals were valid. computed without grants_en_i. 
  12: // yumi_i       - Whether to advance "least priority" pointer to the selected item
  13: //                in some typical use cases, grants_en_i comes from a downstream consumer to indicate readiness;
  14: //                this can be used with v_o to implement ready/valid protocol at both producer (fed into yumi_i) and consumer
  15: 
  16: module bsg_round_robin_arb #(inputs_p      = -1
  17:                                      ,lg_inputs_p   =`BSG_SAFE_CLOG2(inputs_p)
  18:                                      ,reset_on_sr_p = 1'b0
  19:                                      ,hold_on_sr_p  = 1'b0 )
  20:     (input clk_i
  21:     , input reset_i
  22:     , input grants_en_i // whether to suppress grants_o
  23: 
  24:     // these are "third-party" inputs/outputs
  25:     // that are part of the "data plane"
  26: 
  27:     , input  [inputs_p-1:0] reqs_i
  28:     , output logic [inputs_p-1:0] grants_o
  29:     , output logic [inputs_p-1:0] sel_one_hot_o
  30: 
  31:     // end third-party inputs/outputs
  32: 
  33:     , output v_o                           // if grants_en_i (i.e. ready_i) were set, would a grant signal be asserted? 
  34:     , output logic [lg_inputs_p-1:0] tag_o // to which input the grant was given
  35:     , input yumi_i                         // yes, go ahead with whatever grants_o proposed
  36:     );
  37: 
  38: logic [lg_inputs_p-1:0] last, last_n, last_r;
  39: logic hold_on_sr, reset_on_sr;
  40: 
  41: 
  42: 
  43: if(inputs_p == 1)
  44: begin: inputs_1
  45: 
  46: logic [1-1: 0 ] sel_one_hot_n;
  47: 
  48: always_comb
  49: begin
  50:   unique casez({last_r, reqs_i})
  51:     2'b?_0: begin sel_one_hot_n = 1'b0; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end // X
  52:     2'b0_1: begin sel_one_hot_n= 1'b1; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end
  53:     default: begin sel_one_hot_n= {1{1'bx}}; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end // X 
  54:   endcase
  55: end 
  56: 
  57: assign sel_one_hot_o = sel_one_hot_n;
  58: assign grants_o      = sel_one_hot_n & {1{grants_en_i}} ;   
  59:     
  60: 
  61: if ( hold_on_sr_p ) begin 
  62:    
  63:     always_comb begin
  64:         unique casez( last_r )
  65:            1'b0 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 1'b1 );
  66:            default : hold_on_sr = 1'b0;
  67:        endcase
  68:     end //end of always_comb
  69: 
  70: end else begin:not_hold_on_sr_p
  71:     assign hold_on_sr = '0;
  72: end //end of hold_on_sr_p 
  73: 
  74: if ( reset_on_sr_p ) begin:reset_on_1 
  75:     assign reset_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 1'b1 ) 
  76:                        ;
  77: 
  78: end else begin:not_reset_on_sr_p
  79:     assign reset_on_sr = '0;
  80: end //end of reset_on_sr_p 
  81: 
  82: end: inputs_1
  83: 
  84: if(inputs_p == 2)
  85: begin: inputs_2
  86: 
  87: logic [2-1: 0 ] sel_one_hot_n;
  88: 
  89: always_comb
  90: begin
  91:   unique casez({last_r, reqs_i})
  92:     3'b?_00: begin sel_one_hot_n = 2'b00; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end // X
  93:     3'b0_1?: begin sel_one_hot_n= 2'b10; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (1); end
  94:     3'b0_01: begin sel_one_hot_n= 2'b01; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end
  95:     3'b1_?1: begin sel_one_hot_n= 2'b01; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end
  96:     3'b1_10: begin sel_one_hot_n= 2'b10; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (1); end
  97:     default: begin sel_one_hot_n= {2{1'bx}}; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end // X 
  98:   endcase
  99: end 
 100: 
 101: assign sel_one_hot_o = sel_one_hot_n;
 102: assign grants_o      = sel_one_hot_n & {2{grants_en_i}} ;   
 103:     
 104: 
 105: if ( hold_on_sr_p ) begin 
 106:    
 107:     always_comb begin
 108:         unique casez( last_r )
 109:            1'b0 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 2'b01 );
 110:            default: hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 2'b10 );
 111:        endcase
 112:     end //end of always_comb
 113: 
 114: end else begin:not_hold_on_sr_p
 115:     assign hold_on_sr = '0;
 116: end //end of hold_on_sr_p 
 117: 
 118: if ( reset_on_sr_p ) begin:reset_on_2 
 119:     assign reset_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 2'b01 ) 
 120:                        | ( reqs_i == 2'b10 ) 
 121:                        ;
 122: 
 123: end else begin:not_reset_on_sr_p
 124:     assign reset_on_sr = '0;
 125: end //end of reset_on_sr_p 
 126: 
 127: end: inputs_2
 128: 
 129: if(inputs_p == 3)

 860:     14'b1001_?????10000: begin sel_one_hot_n= 10'b0000010000; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (4); end
 861:     14'b1001_????100000: begin sel_one_hot_n= 10'b0000100000; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (5); end
 862:     14'b1001_???1000000: begin sel_one_hot_n= 10'b0001000000; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (6); end
 863:     14'b1001_??10000000: begin sel_one_hot_n= 10'b0010000000; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (7); end
 864:     14'b1001_?100000000: begin sel_one_hot_n= 10'b0100000000; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (8); end
 865:     14'b1001_1000000000: begin sel_one_hot_n= 10'b1000000000; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (9); end
 866:     default: begin sel_one_hot_n= {10{1'bx}}; tag_o = (lg_inputs_p) ' (0); end // X 
 867:   endcase
 868: end 
 869: 
 870: assign sel_one_hot_o = sel_one_hot_n;
 871: assign grants_o      = sel_one_hot_n & {10{grants_en_i}} ;   
 872:     
 873: 
 874: if ( hold_on_sr_p ) begin 
 875:    
 876:     always_comb begin
 877:         unique casez( last_r )
 878:            4'b0000 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0100000000 );
 879:            4'b0001 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0010000000 );
 880:            4'b0010 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0001000000 );
 881:            4'b0011 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0000100000 );
 882:            4'b0100 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0000010000 );
 883:            4'b0101 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0000001000 );
 884:            4'b0110 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0000000100 );
 885:            4'b0111 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0000000010 );
 886:            4'b1000 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0000000001 );
 887:            4'b1001 : hold_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b1000000000 );
 888:            default : hold_on_sr = 1'b0;
 889:        endcase
 890:     end //end of always_comb
 891: 
 892: end else begin:not_hold_on_sr_p
 893:     assign hold_on_sr = '0;
 894: end //end of hold_on_sr_p 
 895: 
 896: if ( reset_on_sr_p ) begin:reset_on_10 
 897:     assign reset_on_sr = ( reqs_i == 10'b0100000000 ) 
 898:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0010000000 ) 
 899:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0001000000 ) 
 900:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0000100000 ) 
 901:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0000010000 ) 
 902:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0000001000 ) 
 903:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0000000100 ) 
 904:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0000000010 ) 
 905:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b0000000001 ) 
 906:                        | ( reqs_i == 10'b1000000000 ) 
 907:                        ;
 908: 
 909: end else begin:not_reset_on_sr_p
 910:     assign reset_on_sr = '0;
 911: end //end of reset_on_sr_p 
 912: 
 913: end: inputs_10
 914: 
 915: 
 916: assign v_o = | reqs_i ;
 917: 
 918: if(inputs_p == 1)
 919:   assign last_r = 1'b0;
 920: else
 921:   begin
 922:     always_comb
 923:       if( hold_on_sr_p ) begin: last_n_gen
 924:         last_n = hold_on_sr ? last_r :
 925:                ( yumi_i     ? tag_o  : last_r );  
 926:       end else if( reset_on_sr_p ) begin: reset_on_last_n_gen
 927:         last_n = reset_on_sr? (inputs_p-2) :
 928:                ( yumi_i     ?tag_o : last_r );  
 929:       end else
 930:         last_n = (yumi_i ? tag_o:last_r);
 931: 
 932:     always_ff @(posedge clk_i)
 933:       last_r <= (reset_i) ? (lg_inputs_p)'(0):last_n;
 934:   end
 935: 
 936: endmodule
